meanings.definition: to rearrange or reorganize in a new way
meanings.sent1: She rejigs her room layout every month to keep it fresh.
meanings.sent2: He often rejigs his work schedule to accommodate new projects.
meanings.sent3: The cat rejigs its sleeping spots, confusing its owner.
meanings.sent4: The puzzle pieces rejigged themselves into a perfect picture.
meanings.sent5: The chef rejigs the menu to feature seasonal ingredients.
